intro: Loeflingia hispanica subsp. baetica, commonly known as the Baetica bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Spain. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
